title: Occasional exception thrown by QueryParser
description:
1. Sometimes an exception is thrown while parsing a query. Another attempt to do the same is crowned with success. See ADDENDUM 1.
2. Sometimes an exception is thrown while parsing a query. Calling System.gc() heals the issue. See ADDENDUM 2.
3. In ADDENDUM 3 listed issue is "deadly". After that no chance of healing.

comments.content:
Rudi: if i'm understanding your description, you have query strings which sometimes can be parsed cleanly, but other times the exact same query string generates an exception.

I can't be 100% certain without seeing the code you have for utilizing QueryParser, but this sounds like a concurrency problem – QueryParser is not threadsafe, behavior like you describe is expected if you attempt to reuse the same QueryParser in multiple threads (i notice in your stack trace you are using a ThreadPoolExecutor ... unless each Thread is constructing it's own QueryParser that would easily explain your problem)

In the future: please consult the java-user mailing list with questions/problems you have before opeinging a Jira issue ... the general practice with Lucene is to ask questions first, then open bugs once a reproducible test case can be created.

on a related note: please keep Jira "descriptions" short, as they are included in every Jira generated email about an issue – use attachments or comments for large stack traces or example code.
comments.author: Hoss Man

comments.content: resolved: incomplete ... not enough detail about use case to understand if this is expected error from concurrency
